archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Chicken Vindaloo Feast with Jeera Rice, Pickled Red Onions, and Oven-Puffed Poppadoms
description: A Goan-inspired chicken vindaloo simmered to a deep tangy heat, paired with fragrant cumin basmati rice, quick pickled red onions, and crisp oven-puffed poppadoms.
prep_steps: Soak 2 cups basmati rice in cold water for 20 minutes, then drain.
Thinly slice 1 large red onion for pickles.
Roughly chop 2 large onions for the curry.
Cut 1.5 kg chicken thighs into large chunks; pat dry and season lightly with salt.
Measure vindaloo spice components: 2 tsp coriander seeds, 2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp cinnamon, 4 cloves, 1 tsp black peppercorns, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp salt.
Rinse and pick 1/2 cup coriander leaves; chop for garnish.
cook_steps: Make quick pickles: In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup apple cider vinegar, 1 tbsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt. Add sliced red onion, toss, and set aside.

Toast vindaloo spices: In a dry pan over medium heat, toast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cloves, and black peppercorns for 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Cool slightly, then crush to a coarse powder (mortar or spice grinder).

Build vindaloo paste: In a bowl, mix crushed spices with chopped garlic, sliced chilies, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/3 cup apple cider vinegar to form a thick paste.
Marinate chicken: Coat chicken thighs with the paste; rest 20 minutes (up to 2 hours refrigerated).
Start curry base: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a wide pot over medium heat. Add chopped onions and a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes until deep golden.
Add 1 cup diced tomatoes and 2 bay leaves; cook 3–4 minutes until thick.
Add marinated chicken; stir to coat. Cook 5 minutes to lightly brown.

Add 1 cup water. Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook on low for 30–35 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce is thick. Adjust with more water if needed; balance to taste with extra apple cider vinegar or a pinch of sugar if too sharp.
Cook jeera rice: In a pot, heat 2 tbsp ghee over medium. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf; sizzle 30 seconds. Stir in drained basmati rice and 1 tsp salt; toast 1 minute.
Add 3 cups water. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Rest off heat 5 minutes, then fluff.
Oven-puff poppadoms: Lightly brush or spray 8 poppadoms with a little oil. Bake on a tray at 200°C/400°F for 1–2 minutes until crisp and blistered.

Finish and serve: Discard bay leaves from curry. Stir in half the chopped coriander. Plate vindaloo with jeera rice, pile on pickled onions, add poppadoms, and serve with lemon wedges and remaining coriander.
